page.title: 06The Island's boats/sea-links
page.content: In 1972 the Polar Bear was purchased by the Landmark Trust.It now operates from Biddiford (previously from Ilfracombe).She was built in Denmark in 1960 for the Greenland trade and although ideal for supplies it can only carry 12 passengers. A dorry called The Islander,specially built in 1981 for Â£40,000,partly fills this need. It acts as the island's 'taxi' and can take visitors round the island and on fishing trips.It's impressively fast and very well equipped. The island also owns a Yorkshire cobble and a landing craft to get goods and passengers to the shore. The paddle steamer Waverley makes about 14 sailings in the summer from Ilfracombe and sometimes Biddiford. { Heather Remes
